content.title: Shaikshanik Chatravriti Yojana
content.details: Getting an education is the basic right of the child. Even today there are many students in our country who are unable to get an education due to their weak economic condition. For all these students, the government operates various types of scholarship schemes. This scheme will be the educational scholarship scheme of the Madhya Pradesh Labor Welfare Board. This scheme will be applicable to the workers/employees working in those institutions/establishments of the state which are governed by M.P. The Labor Welfare Fund comes under the Act 1982 and the Board receives contributions from them regularly.
benefits: The scholarship amount fixed for each class is provided by the board to the students studying in Class 5th to 12th, Graduation, Post Graduation, ITI, Polytechnic, PGDCA, DCA (Computer Course), B.E., M.B.B.S. M.Sc.
The scholarship amount will be paid by the student by e-payment through the Regional Office after the approval of the Welfare Commissioner as per the bank details given along with the application.
eligibility: Applicant must be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh.
The parents of the applicant must be working in a factory or institution established in Madhya Pradesh under the Labor Welfare Fund Act 1982.
Only 2 children in a family are eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.
Children of officers and employees in managerial capacities working in institutions cannot be benefited from this regime.
exclusions: Sons/daughters of officers/employees working in institutions with managerial capacity will not be eligible for this scheme.
documents_required: Latest passport-size photograph (JPEG) of the applicant.
Previous year's mark sheet (JPEG) of the class passed by the applicant.
Photocopy of the first page of the bank passbook of the applicant clearly showing his/her name, bank account number, and IFS code.

faqs.question: What is Shaikshanik Chatravriti Yojana?
faqs.answer: This scheme will be the educational scholarship scheme of MP Labor Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship will be provided by the board to the students studying in Class 5th to 12th, Graduation, Post Graduation, ITI, Polytechnic, PGDCA, DCA (Computer Course), B.E., M.B.B.S. M.Sc.

faqs.question: May other state students apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the Applicant must be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: What will be the applicant's parent working criteria as eligibility?
faqs.answer: The parents of the applicant must be working in a factory or institution established in Madhya Pradesh under the Labor Welfare Fund Act 1982.

faqs.question: How many children are eligible in a family?
faqs.answer: Only 2 children in a family are eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any exception cases for Applicant's Parent Working Criteria As Eligibility?
faqs.answer: Children of officers and employees in managerial capacities working in institutions cannot be benefited from this regime.

faqs.question: How to apply online for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Go to the official portal of the scheme. Applicants have to register themselves. Fill out the required details. Upload the required documents. And submit.

faqs.question: Any document required while applying online?
faqs.answer: Latest passport-size photograph (JPEG) of the applicant, Previous year's mark sheet (JPEG) of the class passed by the applicant, Photocopy of the first page of the bank passbook of the applicant clearly showing his/her name, bank account number, and IFS code.

faqs.question: For which classes/courses will the scholarship be provided?
faqs.answer: To the students studying in Class 5th to 12th, Graduation, Post Graduation, ITI, Polytechnic, PGDCA, DCA (Computer Course), B.E., M.B.B.S. M.Sc.

faqs.question: What will be the mode of scholarship to the students?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount will be paid by the student by e-payment through the Regional Office.
